summary: This is an email chain from December 30-31, 2021, where law enforcement officials congratulate the FBI/NYPD team on the guilty verdict in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The emails praise the team's tenacity, professionalism, and dedication to victims, and reflect on the significance of the case.

persons.name: Michael Osborn
persons.role: Executive Director, Shared Investigative Services, Americas at Standard Chartered Bank
persons.context: Sends the initial congratulatory email to the FBI/NYPD team on the Maxwell verdict, reflecting on the case's history and the team's work.

persons.name: Bill
persons.role: Correspondent (likely law enforcement or government official)
persons.context: Echoes Michael Osborn's congratulations, praises the team's work, and mentions following the trial daily with Mike Osborne and Geoff Berman.

persons.name: Geoff Berman
persons.role: Former U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Mentioned by Bill as someone he checked in with daily during the Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the verdict being celebrated; convicted for her role in Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking scheme.

connections.description: Both are correspondents in the email chain congratulating the FBI/NYPD team on the Maxwell verdict.
Bill mentions checking in with Geoff Berman daily during the Maxwell trial.
Michael Osborn references EM's support for the investigation team from the inception of the case.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell guilty verdict
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was found guilty on multiple counts related to her role in Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking scheme.

keyFacts: The emails celebrate the guilty verdict in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial, seen as justice for victims.
The FBI/NYPD team is praised for their tenacity, professionalism, and victim-focused approach throughout the investigation.
Michael Osborn references "significant issues" in the case that needed escalation to "the highest levels" of the FBI/DOJ.
The correspondence highlights the emotional toll and sacrifices made by the investigation team.
The verdict is viewed as setting a potential precedent for other victims across the country.
